content:
Create a Flow to Send Messages in Standard Channels

This article applies to: Standard WhatsApp, standard Facebook Messenger, and standard SMS channels.

To open, edit, or create a flow in Flow Builder: Manage Flow user permission is required.

When a flow sends an automated message, Salesforce does three things:

* Create a messaging user record for the recipient
* Create a messaging session record with a transcript of the sent message and an unchanging status of Ended
* Add any message errors to the Messaging Templates Error Log page in Setup

To create a flow:

1. From Setup, search for Flows and select Flows.
2. Click New Flow.
3. Select the flow type and click Next.
4. The Flow Builder canvas opens.
5. Add an action to the canvas by searching for Message Notification and selecting it.
6. Fill out the fields for the Message Notification core action:

* Messaging Channel Unique Name
* Messaging Template Unique Name
* Context Record ID
* ConversationBroadcast Record ID (optional)
* Recipient Phone Number (optional)
* Recipient Record ID (optional)
* Triggered Outbound Type (optional)

Note: Use either Recipient Phone Number or Recipient Record ID to ensure the Message Notification action works.

See also: Build a Flow
title: Creating Automated Messages in Service Cloud
